page.title: 09LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: {BELLERBY FEAST OR CLOWNS' DAY __}The men get dressed up as clowns in the morning and then they take a basket and money box round the village.People put food in the basket and they collect money for sports day.At dinner time the children sit around the Cross Tree and eat the cakes that have been collected. They are also given lemonade to drink. Usually on the Saturday after Clowns' Day the sports and fancy dress are held in the playing field. {BELLERBY SWORD DANCE__}This took the form of a dance and a play rather like a mummers' play and possibly has some connection with Clowns' Day,since some of the characters dressed as clowns. It was performed annually until 1872 was revived in 1926 and 1981 and was last performed in 1983 at the Richard III celebrations in Middleham.
